description: A Java-based MCP-compatible tool that provides mathematical operations such as sqrt, pow, log, trig functions, rounding, and more.

actions.name: abs
actions.description: Returns the absolute value of a number. For example, abs(-5) returns 5.

actions.name: sin
actions.description: Returns the sine of an angle in radians. For example, sin(Math.PI/2) returns 1.

actions.name: cos
actions.description: Returns the cosine of an angle in radians. For example, cos(0) returns 1.

actions.name: tan
actions.description: Returns the tangent of an angle in radians. For example, tan(Math.PI/4) returns approximately 1.

actions.name: sqrt
actions.description: Returns the square root of the given number. For example, sqrt(9) returns 3.

actions.name: log
actions.description: Returns the natural logarithm (base e) of a number. For example, log(2.718) returns approximately 1.

actions.name: log10
actions.description: Returns the base-10 logarithm of a number. For example, log10(100) returns 2.

actions.name: pow
actions.description: Raises a number to the power of n. For example, pow(2, 3) returns 8.

actions.name: min
actions.description: Returns the minimum of two numbers. For example, min(10, 15) returns 10.

actions.name: max
actions.description: Returns the maximum of two numbers. For example, max(10, 15) returns 15.

actions.name: floor
actions.description: Returns the greatest integer less than or equal to the given number. For example, floor(4.8) returns 4.

actions.name: ceil
actions.description: Returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to the given number. For example, ceil(4.2) returns 5.

actions.name: round
actions.description: Rounds the given number to the nearest integer. For example, round(4.7) returns 5.

actions.name: mod
actions.description: Returns a modulo b. For example, mod(10, 3) returns 1.

actions.name: square
actions.description: Calculates the square of the given number. For example, square(4) returns 16.

actions.name: gcd
actions.description: Returns the greatest common divisor of two integers. For example, gcd(12, 18) returns 6.

actions.name: degToRad
actions.description: Converts degrees to radians. For example, degToRad(180) returns π.

actions.name: radToDeg
actions.description: Converts radians to degrees. For example, radToDeg(π) returns 180.

actions.name: factorial
actions.description: Returns the factorial of a non-negative integer. For example, factorial(5) returns 120.

actions.name: lcm
actions.description: Returns the least common multiple of two integers. For example, lcm(4, 6) returns 12.

actions.name: factorial
actions.description: Returns the factorial of n. For example, factorial(5) returns 120.

actions.name: catalanNumber
actions.description: Returns the n-th Catalan number. For example, catalanNumber(3) returns 5.

actions.name: multiFactorial
actions.description: Returns the k-step factorial of n (multi-factorial). For example, multiFactorial(9, 2) returns 945.

actions.name: nPr
actions.description: Returns n permute r (nPr), the number of permutations. For example, nPr(5, 2) returns 20.

actions.name: nCr
actions.description: Returns n choose r (nCr), the number of combinations. For example, nCr(5, 2) returns 10.

actions.name: distance2D
actions.description: Returns the Euclidean distance between two points in 2D space. For example, distance2D(0, 0, 3, 4) returns 5.

actions.name: distance3D
actions.description: Returns the Euclidean distance between two points in 3D space. For example, distance3D(0, 0, 0, 1, 2, 2) returns 3.

actions.name: heronArea
actions.description: Returns the area of a triangle using Heron's formula. For example, heronArea(3, 4, 5) returns 6.

actions.name: circleCircumference
actions.description: Returns the circumference of a circle. For example, circleCircumference(2) returns approximately 12.566.

actions.name: rectanglePerimeter
actions.description: Returns the perimeter of a rectangle. For example, rectanglePerimeter(4, 5) returns 18.

actions.name: trianglePerimeter
actions.description: Returns the perimeter of a triangle given the lengths of its three sides. For example, trianglePerimeter(3, 4, 5) returns 12.

actions.name: triangleArea
actions.description: Returns the area of a triangle given base and height. For example, triangleArea(10, 5) returns 25.

actions.name: pythagorean
actions.description: Returns the length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the other two sides. For example, pythagorean(3, 4) returns 5.

actions.name: rectangleArea
actions.description: Returns the area of a rectangle. For example, rectangleArea(4, 5) returns 20.

actions.name: circleArea
actions.description: Returns the area of a circle with given radius. For example, circleArea(2) returns approximately 12.566.

actions.name: isPrime
actions.description: Returns true if the given number is a prime. For example, isPrime(7) returns true.

actions.name: nextPrime
actions.description: Returns the next prime number greater than the given number. For example, nextPrime(10) returns 11.

actions.name: listPrimesInRange
actions.description: Returns a list of prime numbers between start and end (inclusive). For example, listPrimesInRange(10, 20) returns [11, 13, 17, 19].

actions.name: primeFactors
actions.description: Returns the list of prime factors of a number. For example, primeFactors(12) returns [2, 2, 3].

actions.name: countPrimesUpTo
actions.description: Returns the number of prime numbers from 2 up to n (inclusive). For example, countPrimesUpTo(10) returns 4.

actions.name: fibonacci
actions.description: Returns the n-th number in the Fibonacci sequence. For example, fibonacci(5) returns 5.

actions.name: sumArithmeticSeries
actions.description: Returns the sum of the first n terms in an arithmetic sequence. For example, sumArithmeticSeries(2, 3, 5) returns 40.

actions.name: nthTriangularNumber
actions.description: Returns the n-th triangular number (sum of 1 through n). For example, nthTriangularNumber(5) returns 15.

actions.name: generateArithmeticSequence
actions.description: Returns a list containing the first n terms of an arithmetic sequence. For example, generateArithmeticSequence(2, 3, 5) returns [2, 5, 8, 11, 14].

actions.name: generateGeometricSequence
actions.description: Returns a list containing the first n terms of a geometric sequence. For example, generateGeometricSequence(2, 3, 4) returns [2, 6, 18, 54].

actions.name: isFibonacci
actions.description: Returns true if the number is a Fibonacci number. For example, isFibonacci(21) returns true.

actions.name: arithmeticTerm
actions.description: Returns the n-th term of an arithmetic sequence. For example, arithmeticTerm(2, 3, 5) returns 14.

actions.name: sumFibonacci
actions.description: Returns the sum of the first n Fibonacci numbers. For example, sumFibonacci(5) returns 12.

actions.name: sumGeometricSeries
actions.description: Returns the sum of the first n terms in a geometric sequence. For example, sumGeometricSeries(2, 3, 4) returns 80.

actions.name: geometricTerm
actions.description: Returns the n-th term of a geometric sequence. For example, geometricTerm(2, 3, 4) returns 54.

actions.name: mode
actions.description: Returns the mode (most frequent value) of a list of numbers. If multiple values tie, returns the smallest. For example, mode([1, 2, 2, 3]) returns 2.

actions.name: count
actions.description: Returns the count of elements in the list.

actions.name: sum
actions.description: Returns the sum of the numbers.

actions.name: range
actions.description: Returns the range (max - min) of the numbers.

actions.name: mean
actions.description: Returns the average (mean) of a list of numbers. For example, mean([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) returns 3.

actions.name: median
actions.description: Returns the median of a list of numbers. For example, median([3, 1, 4, 2, 5]) returns 3.

actions.name: variance
actions.description: Returns the sample variance of the numbers.

actions.name: standardDeviation
actions.description: Returns the sample standard deviation of the numbers.
